story:
Once upon a time in the ancient land of Iraq, there was a young boy named Ali. Ali lived with his family in a cozy mud-brick house in a small village nestled between the Tigris and Euphrates rivers. Ali was known for his kind heart and adventurous spirit.

One evening, as the sun dipped below the horizon and the stars began to twinkle in the sky, Ali's father sat down beside him on their rooftop terrace. "Ali, my son," he began, "let me tell you a story passed down through generations in our family."

The story was about a wise old owl who lived deep in the heart of the ancient Babylonian forests. This owl had a special gift - the ability to see into the future. People from all corners of the land would come to seek the owl's wisdom and guidance.

One day, a great darkness covered the land, and the people of the kingdom were filled with fear and uncertainty. The owl, with its keen sight, saw that a young child would rise to bring light and hope back to the land. The child would be known for his bravery and compassion, and his name would be Ali.

Ali listened intently to the story, his eyes wide with wonder. His father smiled and said, "My son, remember that no matter how dark the night may seem, there is always hope and light within you. Just like the owl saw the potential in the child named Ali, I see greatness in you."

As Ali drifted off to sleep that night, he dreamt of soaring through the starlit sky with the wise old owl by his side, bringing light and hope to the people of his land.

And so, dear father, as you tuck your son into bed tonight, remember the story of young Ali and the wise owl, and may it inspire your son to embrace his kindness and courage as he dreams of his own adventures in the ancient land of Iraq. Goodnight, and sweet dreams.
